trans-unit.source: How to discover data sources
trans-unit.target: How to discover data sources

trans-unit.source: How-to article highlighting how to discover registered data assets with Azure Data Catalog, including searching and filtering and using the hit highlighting capabilities of the Azure Data Catalog portal.
trans-unit.target: How-to article highlighting how to discover registered data assets with Azure Data Catalog, including searching and filtering and using the hit highlighting capabilities of the Azure Data Catalog portal.

trans-unit.source: How to discover data sources
trans-unit.target: How to discover data sources

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Azure Data Catalog** is a fully managed cloud service that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Azure Data Catalog** is a fully managed cloud service that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.

trans-unit.source: In other words, **Azure Data Catalog** is all about helping people discover, understand, and use data sources, and helping organizations to get more value from their existing data.
trans-unit.target: In other words, **Azure Data Catalog** is all about helping people discover, understand, and use data sources, and helping organizations to get more value from their existing data.

trans-unit.source: Once a data source has been registered with **Azure Data Catalog**, its metadata is indexed by the service, so that users can easily search to discover the data they need.
trans-unit.target: Once a data source has been registered with **Azure Data Catalog**, its metadata is indexed by the service, so that users can easily search to discover the data they need.

trans-unit.source: Searching and filtering
trans-unit.target: Searching and filtering

trans-unit.source: Discovery in **Azure Data Catalog** uses two primary mechanisms: searching and filtering.
trans-unit.target: Discovery in **Azure Data Catalog** uses two primary mechanisms: searching and filtering.

trans-unit.source: Searching is designed to be both intuitive and powerful – by default, search terms are matched against any property in the catalog, including user-provided annotations.
trans-unit.target: Searching is designed to be both intuitive and powerful – by default, search terms are matched against any property in the catalog, including user-provided annotations.

trans-unit.source: Filtering is designed to complement searching.
trans-unit.target: Filtering is designed to complement searching.

trans-unit.source: Users can select specific characteristics such as experts, data source type, object type, and tags, to view only matching data assets, and to constrain search results to matching assets as well.
trans-unit.target: Users can select specific characteristics such as experts, data source type, object type, and tags, to view only matching data assets, and to constrain search results to matching assets as well.

trans-unit.source: By using a combination of searching and filtering, users can quickly navigate the data sources that have been registered with **Azure Data Catalog** to discover the data sources they need.
trans-unit.target: By using a combination of searching and filtering, users can quickly navigate the data sources that have been registered with **Azure Data Catalog** to discover the data sources they need.

trans-unit.source: Search syntax
trans-unit.target: Search syntax

trans-unit.source: Although the default free text search is simple and intuitive, users can also use **Azure Data Catalog**’s search syntax to have greater control over the search results.
trans-unit.target: Although the default free text search is simple and intuitive, users can also use **Azure Data Catalog**’s search syntax to have greater control over the search results.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Data Catalog** search supports the following techniques:
trans-unit.target: **Azure Data Catalog** search supports the following techniques:

trans-unit.source: Technique
trans-unit.target: Technique

trans-unit.source: Use
trans-unit.target: Use

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: Basic Search
trans-unit.target: Basic Search

trans-unit.source: Basic search using one or more search terms.
trans-unit.target: Basic search using one or more search terms.

trans-unit.source: Results are any assets that match on any property with one or more of the terms specified.
trans-unit.target: Results are any assets that match on any property with one or more of the terms specified.

trans-unit.source: sales data
trans-unit.target: sales data

trans-unit.source: Property Scoping
trans-unit.target: Property Scoping

trans-unit.source: Only return data sources where the search term is matched with the specified property
trans-unit.target: Only return data sources where the search term is matched with the specified property

trans-unit.source: name:finance
trans-unit.target: name:finance

trans-unit.source: Boolean Operators
trans-unit.target: Boolean Operators

trans-unit.source: Broaden or narrow a search using Boolean operations
trans-unit.target: Broaden or narrow a search using Boolean operations

trans-unit.source: finance NOT corporate
trans-unit.target: finance NOT corporate

trans-unit.source: Grouping with Parenthesis
trans-unit.target: Grouping with Parenthesis

trans-unit.source: Use parentheses to group parts of the query to achieve logical isolation, especially in conjunction with Boolean operators
trans-unit.target: Use parentheses to group parts of the query to achieve logical isolation, especially in conjunction with Boolean operators

trans-unit.source: name:finance AND (tags:Q1 OR tags:Q2)Comparison Operators
trans-unit.target: name:finance AND (tags:Q1 OR tags:Q2)Comparison Operators

trans-unit.source: Comparison Operators
trans-unit.target: Comparison Operators

trans-unit.source: Use comparisons other than equality for properties that have numeric and date data types
trans-unit.target: Use comparisons other than equality for properties that have numeric and date data types

trans-unit.source: creationTime>"11/05/2014"
trans-unit.target: creationTime>"11/05/2014"

trans-unit.source: For more information on **Azure Data Catalog** search, see [https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt267594.aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt267594.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on **Azure Data Catalog** search, see [https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt267594.aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt267594.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Hit highlighting
trans-unit.target: Hit highlighting

trans-unit.source: When viewing search results, any displayed properties that match the specified search terms – such as the data asset name, description, and tags – will be highlighted to make it easier to identify why a given data asset was returned by a given search.
trans-unit.target: When viewing search results, any displayed properties that match the specified search terms – such as the data asset name, description, and tags – will be highlighted to make it easier to identify why a given data asset was returned by a given search.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Users can turn hit highlighting off if desired, using the “Highlight” switch in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Users can turn hit highlighting off if desired, using the “Highlight” switch in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.

trans-unit.source: When viewing search results, it may not always be obvious why a data asset is included, even with hit highlighting enabled.
trans-unit.target: When viewing search results, it may not always be obvious why a data asset is included, even with hit highlighting enabled.

trans-unit.source: Because all properties are searched by default, a data asset may be returned due to a match on a column-level property.
trans-unit.target: Because all properties are searched by default, a data asset may be returned due to a match on a column-level property.

trans-unit.source: And because multiple users can annotate registered data assets with their own tags and descriptions, not all metadata may be displayed in the list of search results.
trans-unit.target: And because multiple users can annotate registered data assets with their own tags and descriptions, not all metadata may be displayed in the list of search results.

trans-unit.source: In the default tile view, each tile displayed in the search results will include a “View search term matches” icon, which allows the user to quickly view the number of matches and their location, and to jump to them if desired.
trans-unit.target: In the default tile view, each tile displayed in the search results will include a “View search term matches” icon, which allows the user to quickly view the number of matches and their location, and to jump to them if desired.

trans-unit.source: Hit highlighting and search matches in the Azure Data Catalog portal
trans-unit.target: Hit highlighting and search matches in the Azure Data Catalog portal

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: Registering a data source with **Azure Data Catalog** makes that data source easier to discover and understand, by copying structural and descriptive metadata from the data source into the Catalog service.
trans-unit.target: Registering a data source with **Azure Data Catalog** makes that data source easier to discover and understand, by copying structural and descriptive metadata from the data source into the Catalog service.

trans-unit.source: Once a data source has been registered, users can discover it using filtering and search from within the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.
trans-unit.target: Once a data source has been registered, users can discover it using filtering and search from within the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
